text.section:
Upon its determination that the watershed work plan should be submitted to the board of county commissioners, the board of managers shall file the watershed work plan in triplicate with the board of county commissioners. A copy shall be forwarded to the State Soil Conservation Committee. The plan shall show:
The location of the proposed works of improvement on a map, drawing, or aerial photograph.
A general delineation of the boundaries of the public drainage association with the general location in the county or counties affected.
Engineering plans in sufficient detail to describe the proposed project or projects.
A general delineation of the boundaries of each affected individual ownership within the drainage association with an estimate of the acreage which each contains.
The total estimated construction cost of each of the proposed works of improvement.

Within the above plan, the board of managers shall include a statement that they have determined that the works of improvement:
Are practicable;
Will promote the public benefit and be conducive to the public health, safety, and welfare; and
Will produce benefits sufficiently to warrant the expenditures.
